title: Using io.quarkus.logging.Log is only possible with Quarkus bytecode transformation in unit tests (non @QuarkusTest)
body:
### Describe the bug

Hello, we want to test some specific methods of our services which have no dependencies to injected beans.
So we want these tests to be fast without spinning up everything which takes quite some time in our case, so classic unit tests.
Thus, we created unit test class without @QuarkusTest

However, as the service method under test is using `io.quarkus.logging.Log` the test fails.
And I did not find a solution to mock `io.quarkus.logging.Log` as everything from quarkus side seems to assume  `@QuarkusTest`.
Trying to mock with mockito-inline works, but disables the logs.
Is there any way to test service methods that use `io.quarkus.logging.Log` without `@QuarkusTest`?

Example

```
package org.acme;

import io.quarkus.logging.Log;

import javax.enterprise.context.ApplicationScoped;

@ApplicationScoped
public class Service {
    public void serviceMethod() {
        Log.info("I am only a logging method and don't have any dependencies to cdi beans etc.");
    }
}
```

```
package org.acme;

import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;

public class ServiceTest {
    @Test
    public void test(){
        Service service = new Service();
        service.serviceMethod();
    }
}
```

### Expected behavior

console log:
"I am only a logging method and don't have any dependencies to cdi beans etc."
